name: Medusa
description:
In Greek mythology, Medusa (/mɪˈdjuːzə, -sə/; Ancient Greek: Μέδουσα "guardian, protectress")[1] also called Gorgo, was one of the three monstrous Gorgons, generally described as winged human females with living venomous snakes in place of hair. Those who gazed into her eyes would turn to stone. 
-
I was enchanted by her grace and tragic story, wanting to form her pulchritude into this painting
-
I enrich her grace, by the sparks of purple themed colors combination which symbolizes Wisdom, Bravery, Spirituality, power, nobility, luxury, and ambition.
